comments:
Description:
There is a cube with one dimension, and two measures. Pull the dimension and one measure to the crosstab, then update the measure expression reference to the other one, preview failed.

Build version:2.2.0.v20070612-0630

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a cube with one dimension and two measures. 
2. Insert a crosstab in the layout, pull in the dimension and one measure.
3. Choose the crosstab and go to its property editor view. In the "Binding" tab, modify the measure expression and reference to the other measure.
4. Preview the report, failed.

Expected result:
The two measures are defined in the cube, and user could refer to another one.

The bug trace is :

Assign DTE to investigate.
When edit data binding for crosstab, the expression build need be limited to show only dimension/level/measure that already bound to current crosstab.

I think we should support the use case described by the submitter; there are lot of related use cases too. The cross tab data binding should be able to refer to all the cube measures. 
What if user wants to write an expression which shows different images based on different measure values. In this case user may not add a measure to my cross tab detail area, but may just define a column binding and use it.

In some ways this issue is related to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=190722
If this is a lot of change, for BIRT 2.2.1, I am fine with the solution suggested by Zhiqiang and then we can move this bug to BIRt 2.3

Agreed to make the temporary fix in UI suggested by Zhiqiang.
After the change please reassign to BIRT 2.3 for a complete fix. Thanks.

Create CrosstabBindingExpressionProvider for crosstab expression builder which will just should show cube elements that are bound to crosstab.

I have fixed the binding editing scenario, Xiong, please help to fix other scenario that use expresion builder for crosstab.

Replace ExpressionProvider with CrosstabBindingProvider for crosstab.
Fixed.

The expression is valid.
Reassign this bug to DTE to do further investigatement.
For this specific bug,the current solution is ok. However we can do enhancement to extent. That is, automatically find all the referenced measures in binding. As per discussion, the bug is deferred.
We should add measure automatically detecting mechanism in cube query execution time so that user needn't explicitly define a measure in cube query.

Measure automatically detecting mechanism has been added in cube query execution time.

As long as the measure is defined in the cube design time, it will be recognized in the range of cube bindings, filters and sorts.

traces.message: The binding "CREDITLIMIT" refers to invalid measures.
The binding "ORDERNUMBER" refers to invalid measures.
